comment: For the most part its an okay lab, you just have to read up on it beforehand and know what youre doing. HOWEVER, hes incredibly impatient with you if you get confused about something or are not sure what to do, hell mock you and say you didnt listen even if you simply didnt understand. You can tell he wants to get out of lab as soon as he can

Dr. Rama was one of my favorite professors this semester! He clearly outlines each day what he expects of us for the labs, and answers any questions the students have. He has a bit of an accent, however it doesn't take long to get used to! Rama himself is funny and sometimes pokes fun at the students, and you can tell he cares about the subject!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Super nice professor, wants you to do the labs correctly and explains common mistakes beforehand to help you. The pre-lab quizzes count. Accepts late work if not too* late. He does have an accent, but after 1-2 classes it's not a problem. It also makes him funnier. Likes to tease students who aren't paying attention. 10/10, taking him for 1212L.

Best lab professor. He is an Indian man who does not have the best English, but he is a friendly guy. At first he may seem tough and mean (and to an extent he is strict), but it's really manageable and he is a friendly dude. Just DO YOUR PRELABS, go to EVERY LAB, and have some awareness of what you're doing. Pick a good partner at the start. GL
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough Grader--Respected

comment: He's really funny, and actually cares about your learning. He will explain chemistry concepts to you (that your lecture teacher is supposed to do) until you understand. He helps you with all the calculations you need to do for labs. He doesn't really answer emails though, and takes a while to update grades, otherwise he's great!

Some say he is hard to understand but honestly, if you listen, he's pretty clear in lab... maybe it'd be different in a lecture. He is hilarious and will joke around with you. If you ask questions during lab, he will almost give you the answers! He does take a while to explain at the beginning, but it's minor. Make sure to do your book every week!!

If you want to pass you have to teach yourself, and even then you might not because the homework is often nothing like the tests, and the final is standardized. He doesn't know how to use myChemLab so the due dates changed a lot, he gets behind on the material, and yells at you for leaving if he's not done talking even if it's past time to go.
Gives lot of written information, solved problems, notes, questions. Very helpful and friendly

Worst professor ever. He has a thick accent, which makes him difficult to understand. He jumps all over the place with his "lesson plan", if that's what you could even call it. When you ask him a question you have to repeat it 7 different ways so he'll understand what you are asking, only to say he's already covered it and you should know it by now
not a clue what the hell this man is saying. he goes off topic constantly and the majority of the class has issues passing
Great teacher. Really cares. Repeats and ikes participation

Very funny and helpful lab instructor - his pre-lab lectures tend to ramble, but he does explain what to do and any possible shortcuts or pitfalls in the procedure.  He tends to be VERY nitpicky on his grading and he did start handing out lab quizzes in the second half of the semester and didn't quite make it clear that they were quizzes
works hard to make sure his students understand what he teaches. Handouts are great. solves many problem on the board. Never gets mad. Asks questions. Very caring. wants his students to succeed.

Forgets to teach half the stuff. Sapling asks you questions which you never learned how to do in class. Taking notes is impossible since he is all over the place. Class average is well below failing (~50%), and NO CURVE. I though why not take this class since it's the only prof that fits my schedule. Noy was I wrong. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Terrible avoid at all costs.

I took Dr.R's chemistry 1 course last spring. He is patient with his students. He involves students in solving problems. He write on board everything he says. His handout are very useful and complete.

Overall he is a great professor who will work with you if you just ask for help. ATTEND Lecture though and take good notes! His tests always start off with a fill in the blank memorization then works into problems. He will kind of go off into a tangent every now and then but overall a good professor.
Ramaswamy is a great prof. He takes a lot of interest in his students. Explains, givestudents.I strongly recommend his class

Let's just say no-one knows how this guy made it as a prof or earned a degree.  He messes up on every problem he works out and can't even do significant numbers, which is the easiest thing in chemistry. Loses grades, has no office hours, yells when you ask questions. 50 people started the semester, 10 ended it without a W. BEWARE!!!

Never came to class prepared and always got lost doing his own examples. His lecture style is extremely boring and it doesn't help that when he would write on the board, he would jump from one concept to the other.

He did a horrible job with the lab.  He lost grades constantly and I had to get the TA to verify I turned them in.  He later found....but where?  Unable to add and take an average.  Most grades were errored and had to be fixed.

Overall he is dumbest chemistry professor I know.  His lecture style is all over the place which makes note taking very difficult.  He messes up problems on the board on a daily basis making his creditability extremely low.  Grading is obscure and messes up that often as well.  Only good thing, most of his test are the same from previous sems.

very boring...doesnt cover material thats on the test in depth at all. Never brings his book to class and asks someone else to read him the problem because "I left my book today", but it happens EVERYDAY. Its actually easier to learn from the book because he is horrible at explaining problems.
No Comments
